description: '''Tommy Shannon''' (born '''Thomas Lafitte Smedley'''; April 18, 1946) is an American [[bass guitarist]], who is best known as a member of [[Double Trouble (band)|Double Trouble]], a [[blues rock]] band led by [[Stevie Ray Vaughan]]. Born in [[Tucson, Arizona]], Shannon moved to [[Dumas, Texas]] when he was nine, where he originally started as a guitarist, though he started playing bass at the age of 21. He appeared with [[Johnny Winter]] at [[Woodstock]] in 1969. He later joined Double Trouble in 1981 and became a permanent member of Double Trouble until Vaughan's death in 1990. Shannon and bandmate [[Chris Layton]] later formed supergroups such as the [[Arc Angels]].
